rationale: The correct answer is .0014. It's given that a certain type of substance can contain a maximum of 0.001% phosphorus by mass to meet a set of standards. If a sample of the substance has a mass of 140 grams, it follows that the maximum mass, in grams, of phosphorus the sample can contain to meet the standards is 0.001% of 140 , or 0.001100140, which is equivalent to 0.00001140, or 0.0014 . Note that .0014 and 0.001 are examples of ways to enter a correct answer.
stem: According to a set of standards, a certain type of substance can contain a maximum of 0.001% phosphorus by mass. If a sample of this substance has a mass of 140 grams, what is the maximum mass, in grams, of phosphorus the sample can contain to meet these standards?
